title: Drivers License — Study Guide
description: Learn core rules and reasoning to pass the Drivers license test on Voxel.

items.question: Should you brake in such a situation?
items.explanation: Brake when there is safe stopping distance to avoid collisions.

items.question: Can you stop on this part of the sidewalk?
items.explanation: Stopping on sidewalks blocks pedestrians and is unsafe.

items.question: Can you make a left turn in this situation?
items.explanation: Left turns are allowed unless prohibited by signage.

items.question: Can you turn right at this point without stopping?
items.explanation: You may turn if it is safe and traffic permits, unless a stop is mandatory.

items.question: What is the maximum speed you can travel on this road?
items.explanation: The maximum is 110km/h unless otherwise signposted.

items.question: Can the road shown in the photo be traveled in both directions?
items.explanation: No, it is a one-way road. Driving against flow risks collision.

items.question: Can you turn left at this point?
items.explanation: Turning is prohibited here by signage.

items.question: Which of these pavement markings separates two lanes traveling in the same direction?
items.explanation: Broken white lines separate lanes in the same direction. Others do not.

items.question: This sign means:
items.explanation: Pedestrian crossing ahead – slow down and prepare to stop.

items.question: This sign means:
items.explanation: Do not enter – indicates a prohibited roadway.

items.question: Can you pass another vehicle when approaching a curve or a hill?
items.explanation: No, visibility is limited. Wait until the road ahead is clear.

items.question: Which of the following places is a U-turn allowed?
items.explanation: U-turns are only legal where specifically signposted.

items.question: Finish the sentence - You should...
items.explanation: Always drive to the conditions of the road and weather.

items.question: When driving in fog, rain, or snow, always use ___
items.explanation: Low beams reduce glare and improve vision in poor weather.

items.question: A broken yellow centerline means that:
items.explanation: Passing is allowed on the left when the way is clear.

items.question: Alcohol is
items.explanation: Alcohol is a depressant, slowing reflexes and impairing judgment.

items.question: Before you change lanes, you should check your mirrors and
items.explanation: Always shoulder check blind spots before moving lanes.
